message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with problems in computational geometry, specifically with circumscribing polygons and polygonizations for planar straight-line graphs and arrangements of line segments. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves combinatorial aspects, such as determining whether a graph admits a circumscribing polygon, which suggests that it could also be classified under cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper mentions relations to other problems in combinatorial geometry, which could place it under cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). Finally, the paper discusses the NP-completeness of certain problems, which could classify it under cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
